description: Come visit us at Gather, a hot glass studio in Charlton / Woolwich for an open studio day. On Saturday 21st September, we are running a number of pre-book short, exciting classes where participants will 'blow their own bauble' for £55 each. At 3pm we will host a free studio tour with glass blowing demonstrations. Visit us see the process in action!

designers.architect: Designed by Edward George Rivers and built by Kirk and Randall in 1882–3

events.name: Drop in: Glassblowing open studio
events.notes: Come and visit our studio and watch glassblowing classes with the public. You will be accepting walks ins or you can book on our website.

events.name: Guided tour and demos of glassblowing studio
events.notes: A guided tour of our glassblowing studio with some demons thrown in! Learn about how Gather set up the unique space. All questions welcome!

factsheet.heading: Gather Glass
paragraphs:
We are a hot glass studio based in Charlton / Woolwich. Gather was set up by founder, Phoebe Stubbs in summer 2023. Since then, she and her small artisan team have been producing glassware for Gather and for a number of interior and lighting clients. 
The studio runs on a large electric furnace – a commitment to reducing the use of fossil fuels. Gather also has two small electric furnaces for melting waste glass as well as a double ended reheating furnace, designed to make two workstations from one.

location.address: Unit 4, Submarine Cable Depot, Bloc, Warspite Rd,, SE18 5NX
travel_info: Additional travel info: You can walk along the river from Woolwich or catch a very short bus. Buses also run right to our studio from Greenwich studio.

name: Glassblowing open studio
